pages.text: Like trees, mushrooms can also sprout and even tower over one or the other tree. With mushrooms, it just takes a little longer if the conditions are right. An earthy subsoil is required.
In addition, the supply of nutrients and the environment are crucial.
With good swell and enough space, a mushroom can grow in no time at all.

A mushroom can also assume its large form on its own with enough space. Nutrient-rich soils such as $(l:mycology/mycelium)Mycelium$() or Podzol are ideal for this. For other surfaces, a dark environment is required.$(br2)A group of 4 mushrooms can also grow into a gigantic mushroom. The size can compete with tropical trees.
